hc.server.util.calendar

Interface JobCalendar

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnnualJobCalendar, HolidayJobCalendar, MonthlyJobCalendar, WeeklyJobCalendar

    public interface JobCalendar
extends Serializable, Cloneable
    An interface to be implemented by objects that define spaces of time during which an associated Trigger may (not) fire. Calendars do not define actual fire times, but rather are used to limit a Trigger from firing on its normal schedule if necessary. Most Calendars include all times by default and allow the user to specify times to exclude.

    As such, it is often useful to think of Calendars as being used to exclude a block of time - as opposed to include a block of time. (i.e. the schedule "fire every five minutes except on Sundays" could be implemented with a SimpleTrigger and a WeeklyJobCalendar which excludes Sundays)

    Implementations MUST take care of being properly Cloneable and Serializable.

    Author:
    James House, Juergen Donnerstag

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object clone() 
      JobCalendar getBaseJobCalendar()
      Get the base calendar.
      String getDescription()
      Return the description given to the JobCalendar instance by its creator (if any).
      long getNextIncludedTime(long timeStamp)
      Determine the next time (in milliseconds) that is 'included' by the JobCalendar after the given time.
      boolean isTimeIncluded(long timeStamp)
      Determine whether the given time (in milliseconds) is 'included' by the JobCalendar.
      void setBaseJobCalendar(JobCalendar baseCalendar)
      Set a new base calendar or remove the existing one.
      void setDescription(String description)
      Set a description for the JobCalendar instance - may be useful for remembering/displaying the purpose of the calendar, though the description has no meaning to Quartz.
